name: Americas Wildest Show Rods of the '60s (CarTech) [Paperback] Autographed by Fritz
description:
The 1960s and 1970s were a time of artistic excess. Crazy outfits, new-found freedoms of the boomer generation, and the hippie movement, all created an explosion of style completely unique to the period and generation. The 1960s and 1970s were also a time of intense automotive enthusiasm. New car launches every September were greeted with anticipation, muscle cars with excessive horsepower were the norm, and the average Joe was rodding and racing every weekend. 

When these two forces came together, the results were unforgettable. A new breed of car was developed-the Show Rod. These creations were never intended for use on the streets, and many of them were never intended for any use at all. Customizers designed and built them to attract huge crowds to the big car show circuit that was travelling the country at the time, and in that they certainly succeeded. 

What began as visions of futuristic cars eventually morphed into cartoon-like representations of cars. Things got wilder when the model car industry got involved, and then television shows and pop music acts jumped in too. Icons like Barris and Roth, household names even to fringe car guys, made their name in this era, as did others like Gene Winfield, Dean Jeffries, Candy Joe Bailon, Bob Reisner, Darryl Starbird and Tom Daniel, all important characters in promoting, designing and building this insane pieces of rolling artwork. 

Fritz contributed his knowledge and photos of his work to this book of his Ed Roth "Outlaw" clone, restoration of Ed Roth's "Megacycle" and his "Roswell Rod", as well as cars that he painted and pinstriped like the Ed Roth "Mysterion" clone, Dan Woods "Ice Truck", and more.

This book is autographed by Fritz.

This completely unique book is a round-table discussion featuring all of these great customizers discussing the era, their builds, and each others rods as well.

name: NEW! Lace and True A Motorcycle Wheel at Home - Two DVD Set
description:
There really is no mystery, it just takes a lot of patience and practice. In this DVD set I do my best to walk you through every step of wheel rebuilding. I start with taking a motorcycle wheel apart and then cleaning and greasing the bearings. Then I show setting new races, lacing up 2 different style wheel hubs, and truing them up in a truing stand and the rear swing arm of an old Harley Super Glide. This really is a task that anyone can learn and do at home in the garage.

2 Disk Set - 3 hours long

Disk 1
1-Introduction
2 - Getting to Know Your Wheels
3 - Disassembly and Cleaning
4- Rear Wheel Bearings
5- Cleaning Rims and Spokes
6- Lacing Rear Wheel
7- Installing Rear Bearings and Seals
8- Polishing Aluminum

Disk 2
9- Lacing the Front Wheel
10-The Truing Stand
11- Truing the Front Wheel, Radial Run Out & Side to Side Play
12- Truing the Rear Wheel on the Frame

Click on this link for a sneak preview
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nHi571Qkblo

name: How To Paint Your Motorcycle At Home Two DVD Set
description:
Fritz takes you every step of the way to a top quality show worthy professional custom paint job. You will see everything from making paint stands, body work, gold leafing, pinstriping, and custom paint tricks. Two DVDs with 3 1/2 hours of "can't live without" information and technique. This DVD set doesn't gloss over the process like others might. Fritz talks to you like your one of the guys hanging around the garage, and shows you how to get a big money look for low bucks and basic tools. We are proud to say that these DVDs are for the average every day guy working at home in his spare time.

2 Disk Set 4 hours long

Disk 1
1-Getting Started
2- Priming and Guide Coat
3- Fixing Guide Coat Imperfections
4- Spraying Base Coat
5- Taping Out Graphics
6- Fogs & Blends

Disk 2
7- Artwork & Airbrush
8- Spraying Candy Colors
9- Quick Lesson in Gold Leafing
10- Making a Pounce Pattern
11-Wet Sanding Clear
12- Pinstriping and Outlining
12- Final Clear and Polishing

Click on the link below for a sneak preview
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=brKCaPcB8gM

name: How To Build A Fiberglass Body At Home Two DVD Set
description:
Fritz takes you step by step as he builds his own creation from nothing and you can too. No expensive tools or big fancy shop, just Fritz in his two car garage at home. Learn how to make your own one of kind professional quality show car body. There wont be another one anywhere like it. Fritz starts with a handbuilt chassis made from junk parts and box steel. He uses a motor & parts from the junkyard. Then you will see it all come together from a plaster buck, laying down fiberglass, attaching the body to the frame, even making a ring for the bubble, Fritz's signature feature taken from the days when show cars were "show" cars. You will be amazed what you can do. With a few simple ingredients you can create a masterpiece. As always Fritz shows how anyone can do this, at home, with a lot of hard work, and with this DVD a lot of know how.

2 Disk Set - 4 Hours Long

Disk 1
1-In the Beginning
2-Milk Crates, Wood Planks, & Spit Wads
3- Mixing the Plaster Concoction
4- Plaster, Final Coat & Shaping
5-Fiberglassing & Mold Release
6- Breaking the Body from the Mold
(continues on disk 2)

Disk 2
(continued from disk 1)
6-Breaking the Body from the Mold
7- Body Fit & Mounts
8- Gluing the Steel Mounts to the Body
9- Making a Bubble Ring
10- "Baja Bandeeto" Walk around
11- "Roswell Rod" Walk around

Click on the link below for a sneak peak
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zOp4m9ndp2w

name: Chop A Model A Top At Home Two DVD Set
description:
The most popular custom trick of all time has to be the "Top Chop" And the most popular car to Chop has to be the Model "A" Ford. Work alongside Fritz in his garage as he Chops a 1930 Ford coupe 2 1/4 inches, fills the roof opening with an old Chevy station wagon donor panel, and shows you every step of the way how he did it, all at home, with basic tools. Window garnish moldings, the windshield frame, nothing is left out, every step is covered in this 2 DVD set! Now the third in the series, check online to see more dvds with Frtiz's no nonsence approach.

2 Disk Set - 4 Hours Long

Disk 1
1- Introduction
2- Rear T-Strips & Sunvisor
3- Filling the Roof
4- Measure a Lot, Cut Once
5- Top Fit, Alignment, & Relief Cuts
6- Fitting Door Tops

Disk 2
7- Chopping the Window Garnish trim
8- Chopping the Windshield Frame
9- Chopping the A-Pillar Post Trim
10- Final Walk Around

Click the link below for a sneak peak
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gDyba8sB_QY

name: MEN'S SPRITZ BY FRITZ T-SHIRT
description: OK Gang! Back by popular demand, the official Spritz By Fritz shop T-shirt. You know you want it. A slobbering monster dumping the clutch at 9 grand and his nitro breathing bubble top bomb. We made a limited run of these so when they are gone they are gone man.

name: MEN'S ROSWELL ROD T-SHIRT
description: "Spritz By Fritz" brings you our latest t-shirt featuring the Ed Roth inspired Roswell Rod award winning bubble top car. Completely designed, built, and painted by Fritz Schenck famous for his work on numerous Ed Roth restorations and recreations such as: restoration of "The Megacycle", recreation of "The Outlaw", restoration of "The Druid Princess", and paint and pinstriping of "The Mysterion". Get a a piece of history and show that you support the craft of true custom show cars. The front is printed the official "Sprits By Fritz" logo and the back features a beautiful rendering of the "Roswell Rod" by Jim Smith in full color.

name: WOMEN'S ROSWELL ROD T-SHIRT
description: "Spritz By Fritz" brings you our latest t-shirt featuring the Ed Roth inspired Roswell Rod award winning bubble top car. Completely designed, built, and painted by Fritz Schenck famous for his work on numerous Ed Roth restorations and recreations such as: restoration of "The Megacycle", recreation of "The Outlaw", restoration of "The Druid Princess", and paint and pinstriping of "The Mysterion". Get a a piece of history and show that you support the craft of true custom show cars. The front features a beautiful rendering of the "Roswell Rod" by Jim Smith in full color.

name: WOMEN'S SPRITZ BY FRITZ T-SHIRT
description: OK Gang! Back by popular demand, the official Spritz By Fritz shop T-shirt. You know you want it. A slobbering monster dumping the clutch at 9 grand and his nitro breathing bubble top bomb. We made a limited run of these so when they are gone they are gone man.

name: Roswell Rod 1/24TH Scale Complete Resin Model Kit
description:
Build an exact replica of the "Roswell Rod" yourself in 1/24th scale. 

This kit includes everything you need except paint. Email us about the paint.

Enclosed you will find following:
-Body and chassis
-Interior, dash seats, front and rear grill, steering wheel and shifter
-headlights and taillights
-engine, valve covers, blower, bracket, belt, carbs, scoop, exhausts
-wheels and brake drums
-bubble top 
-decals for all graphics
-detailed instructions and photos

base sold separately

name: Roswell Rod Model Kit Base and Figures
description:
The "Roswell Rod" lunar model base with earthling and alien.

model sold separately

name: Ed Roth's Wishbone Resin Model Body
description:
For the Resin Car model enthusiast, and Ed Roth fan. Now build the model of an Ed Roth car that was never produced. It got its name from the frame design: two frame rails welded together down the center of the car and forked out in a wishbone shape at the rear, where it housed a Volkswagen engine. Roth fabricated his own intake manifold for this car and took off the fan and shrouding. The front of the car was half Ford and half VW. The Wishbone is a hidden secret and now you can build one yourself.

*This is not a whole kit just the body.

name: Ed Roth's Globehopper Resin Model Body
description:
For the Resin Car model enthusiast, and Ed Roth fan. Ed had been riding trikes for fifteen years when he decided to make "Globe Hopper"it had a big gas tank and a trouble free 1800cc VW engine that he pulled out of a Porsche 914 coupe. Ed drove all the way to Alaska in the Globe Hopper which is fashioned a little like a '34 Ford Roadster. Now you can build one too! This is the car that Ed got kicked out of the street rod nationals with.

*This is not a whole kit just the body.

name: Fiberglass Roller
description: A lot of you guys have e-mailed me asking "Where do I get that roller thing for the fiberglass?" So, I figured I would just make it easy on everyone and carry them on my site. Its a plastic handle and a plastic roller. It will work fine, ya just have to keep it clean and wash it up with acetone.

name: Resin Brushes (Box of 12)
description: Better known as a "chip brush" these are the cheap-ass brushes that you see at swap meets and home improvement stores. Well, as long as I am gonna carry the fiberglass rollers I might as well carry the resin brushes also. These are the same ones I use, usually once or twice and then toss 'em.

name: Piston Shift Knob
description:
This high compression domed mini piston shift knob is a Spritz by Fritz exclusive!

3" - 5" tall, unpainted, resin shift knob. Use them on your car or collect them all. Can be drilled and tapped to fit.

name: Human Skull Shift Knob
description:
This human skull shift knob is a Spritz by Fritz exclusive!

3" - 5" tall, unpainted, resin shift knob. Use them on your car or collect them all. Can be drilled and tapped to fit.

name: Monkey Skull Shift Knob
description:
This monkey skull piston shift knob is a Spritz by Fritz exclusive! 

3" - 5" tall, unpainted, resin shift knob. Use them on your car or collect them all. Can be drilled and tapped to fit.

*This is not made from an actual monkey skull, No monkeys were harmed in the process.

name: Jimmy Flintstone Martian Shift Knob
description: 3" - 5" tall, unpainted, resin shift knob. Use them on your car or collect them all. Can be drilled and tapped to fit.

name: Jimmy Flintstone "Zipper-Head" Frankenstein Shift Knob
description: 3" - 5" tall, unpainted, resin shift knob. Use them on your car or collect them all. Can be drilled and tapped to fit.

name: Custom Cars by Matt Doeden
description:
People customize their cars to look cool, go fast – or both. For some owners, custom cars are more than just vehicles. They are a hobby, a passion, even a way of life. From high powered hot rods to fast and colorful tuner cars, each type of custom has a unique culture surrounding it. Inpire the next generation of motor heads with this children's book. In this book your kids will discover:
  • Cool classic customs and hot new styles
  • Expert car customizers
  • World-famous custom cars
  • Events where car lovers show off their machines
48 pages paperback.

name: Darryl Starbird - "The Bubble Top King" By Darryl Starbird and Brice Bledsoe
description:
The history of Darryl Starbird's nearly half century career. He has designed and built over 100 unbelievable custom auto creations. Monogram Model Company produced more than a dozen of his designs into 1/8 and 1/24 scale for the model car enthusiast. This multi talented man produced over 400 Rod and Custom car shows throughout the country. In 1995 he created the Custom Car Hall of Fame Museum displaying over 25 of his most famous cars as well as other Hall of Fame member's cars. This book is full of photos and quotes of the Bubble Top King himself and his amazing creations.

Full Color Hard Cover.

Signed by Darryl Starbird

name: Spritz By Fritz Decal
description: Collectible decal featuring the official Spritz By Fritz Slobbering monster and his voluptuous vixen out for a high speed wheel squealing drive. 4 x 5 inches, opaque vinyl, crack and peel decal, with adhesive on back.

name: Roswell Rod Vinyl Decal
description:
Collectible decal featuring Fritz's famous "Roswell Rod." 
Illustration by the well known hot rod artist Jimmy Smith.
7 x 4 inches, opaque vinyl, crack and peel decal, with adhesive on back.

Safe for indoor or outdoor use.

name: Don't Touch My Car! Decal
description: Collectible decal featuring Mr. Goodpliers giving you the stink eye, making sure you keep your sticky fingers off his car. 4 x 5 inches, opaque vinyl, crack and peel decal, with adhesive on back.

name: I Don't Lend Out my Tools! Decal
description: Collectible decal featuring Mr. Goodpliers who will beat you senseless with his monkey wrench, and will pluck your nostril hairs out one at a time if you ask to borrow his tools. 4 x 5 inches, opaque vinyl, crack and peel decal, with adhesive on back.

name: Roswell Rod Souvenir Postcard
description: Roswell Rod full-color 4x6 postcard. Printed on one side is a high gloss image of the car capturing attention across the globe the "Roswell Rod." The other side has the official "Spritz by Fritz" logo and a place to address and stamp it for the mail. Keep it on your garage wall or mail it to all your friends to show how cool you are to support a true custom show car.

name: Margarita Chiquita Souvenir Postcard
description: The second in the Spritz By Fritz Collector Postcard series. Featuring the "Iron Horse Magazine" Project Bike. Still Fritz's personal bike winning him many first in show awards over the years. it is a 1960 Harley Davidson Panhead. A true Old School Chopper. Buy two save one for the garage wall or tool box, and mail one to a friend.

name: 1957 Pontiac Bumper Ends
description:
1957 Pontiac rear bumper ends. You never see these in good shape and if you have an Old Poncho ya probably need a set. These are "SOLID" aluminum, about 10 pounds each! Drill and tap them on the back side, and bolt them on. They can be chrome plated or installed as is. Sold only here at Spritz By Fritz.

Sold as a pair.

name: Dashboard Hula Girl
description:
This Hawaiian cutey will look great on your hot rod. After a few Mai Tais you'll swear she is playing "Stairway to Heaven" on the ukulele. 

6.5" Dancing Hula Girl. Comes in a Hula Beach Box.
